text: Hi. We are about to use a third party cookie bar to allow or disallow tracking codes. Since we are using an external system with a CMS (Typo3) I would like to use a solution inside of this system. So until people accepts cookies those are not loaded. I already have the solution but my question is about HubSpot. For Analytics etc, allowing them will fire them. But for HubSpot there's 2 solution. The first one would be to always fire the cookies when the tracking code from HubSpot is active. But then if people are not accepting HubSpot would not be loaded (for exemples the forms). Is there a way to push the optin value to HubSpot when someone click on accept? I couldn't find anything in the doc
Hi <@UA5DFM7CK> did you find anything to tackle this with?

If I'm looking to create a comprehensive sign up or application form is there a preferred app that integrates with HubSpot? I'd like the functionality of a multi step form, collect payment options, etc... any ideas?
you can use the jotform integration
ok I see. Thank you Gonzalo
<@U7WV8C5LN> nope, I just had to switch to a different email template.

Argh. Yep I’ve been trying to spark some conversation about the drag and drop email tool paddings as well at the <#CES6JU0RY|drag-drop-email-beta> channel I know that I’ve heard it being on the roadmap but have not heard of any workarounds for it yet :S
If anybody is at the SF user group event today, hit me up. I'll be here all morning....
does anybody know if the pre provisioning of SSL is still possible via a CNAME update value versus the email confirmation
the email confirmation never seems to work anymore... and while SSL seems to roll over fine even without it i have an enterprise client i'm worried about making that assumption for
We have been asked by our client to provide server logs for their HubSpot site. Any ideas?
